hypothesis_content.title: Binance APR Offer Catalyst Amplification on Low-Float Tokens
hypothesis_content.statement: Following the Binance 20% APR offer announcement for USD1, low-float tokens with similar high-staking yield narratives will experience amplified, short-term price surges (15-25%) within 48 hours, driven by retail flow seeking the next high-yield opportunity, before mean-reverting.
hypothesis_content.rationale: The USD1 surge demonstrates intense retail demand for high nominal yields in a low-rate crypto environment. This creates a 'playbook' catalyst where traders immediately scan for similar narratives. Low-float tokens are susceptible to amplified moves due to limited sell-side liquidity. The effect is transient as it's driven by momentum speculation, not sustainable fundamentals.
entry_conditions: Token is listed on Binance or a top-5 CEX
Token has circulating supply < 50% of total supply (low float)
Token announces a staking/yield program with APR > 15% within 24 hours of the USD1 news

exit_conditions.take_profit: 22% gain from entry price OR 4-hour candle close below its 20-period EMA after the initial surge

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: A sample of 3+ qualifying tokens shows average returns < 5% over the 48-hour window post-announcement, indicating the catalyst did not spill over or was already priced in.
